page.title: 14MARKET TRADE IN AYLESBURY
page.content: We asked stall owners on the market about {trade} in Aylesbury. The majority said that trade was not as good as it used to be. All of them said that they had stalls on other {markets} and that Aylesbury was the poorest. Some of the traders said that most of the new supermarkets were luring people away from the market area. Many said they had regular customers. One lady owned a bread store and she told us that a large {food} store supplied her rolls and doughnuts. We also visited the {cattle market} which has been open for about 40 years. Most of the farmers were local or were within a 30 mile radius of Aylesbury. The farmers were bidding for cattle and sheep. The average weight of the cattle was 540 lbs.
